Control Name: 5.10.2 The workload communicates over encrypted (TLS / HTTPS) network channels only.
Control Statement: Any network communication between client and server where man-in-the-middle attack can occur, needs to be encrypted. All website communication should use HTTPS, no matter the perceived sensitivity of transferred data (man-in-the-middle attacks can occur anywhere on the site, not just on login forms).
